title: Physical pendulums - the swinging single bar

content.question: A bar with uniform density has a mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is used to make a physical pendulum, as shown in the figure. The pivot for the pendulum is located a distance <math alttext="the fraction L over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn></math> from the top end of the bar, and the bar’s rotational inertia about its center is <math alttext="the fraction 1 over 12, end fraction, M L squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. What is the oscillation period of the pendulum?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction 4 over 3, end fraction, times the fraction L over g, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction 7 over 12, end fraction, times the fraction L over g, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction 1 over 3, end fraction, times the fraction L over g, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction 7 over 48, end fraction, times the fraction L over g, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>48</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 pi times the square root of the fraction 7 over 12, end fraction, times the fraction L over g, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>12</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>g</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
